verb.description: Hum or sing in a soft, low voice, especially in a sentimental manner.
examples: she was crooning to the child
the female vocalist crooned smoky blues into the microphone

noun.description: A soft, low voice or tone.
examples: he sang in a gentle, highly expressive croon

origin: Late 15th century (originally Scots and northern English): from Middle Low German and Middle Dutch krōnen groan, lament. The use of croon in standard English was probably popularized by Robert Burns.
